io.cdap.http

Interface HttpResponder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHttpResponder

    public interface HttpResponder
    HttpResponder is used to send response back to clients.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • sendJson

        void sendJson(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
            String jsonString)
        Sends json response back to the client. This is a convenient method to send json encoded string with content type automatically set to application/json.
        Parameters:
        status - Status of the response.
        jsonString - The json string to send back.

      • sendString

        void sendString(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
              String data)
        Send a string response in UTF-8 encoding back to the http client.
        Parameters:
        status - status of the Http response.
        data - string data to be sent back.

        Send a string response in UTF-8 encoding back to the http client.
        Parameters:
        status - status of the Http response.
        data - string data to be sent back.
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.

      • sendByteArray

        void sendByteArray(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
                 byte[] bytes,
                 io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Send a response containing raw bytes. Default content type is "application/octet-stream", but can be overridden by the headers parameter.
        Parameters:
        status - status of the Http response.
        bytes - bytes to be sent back.
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.

      • sendBytes

        void sendBytes(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
             ByteBuffer buffer,
             io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Sends a response containing raw bytes. Default content type is "application/octet-stream", but can be overridden by the headers parameter.
        Parameters:
        status - status of the Http response
        buffer - bytes to send
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.

      • sendChunkStart

        io.cdap.http.ChunkResponder sendChunkStart(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status)
        Respond to the client saying the response will be in chunks. The response body can be sent in chunks using the ChunkResponder returned.
        Parameters:
        status - the status code to respond with
        Returns:
        chunk responder for sending the response

      • sendChunkStart

        io.cdap.http.ChunkResponder sendChunkStart(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
                                         io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Respond to the client saying the response will be in chunks. The response body can be sent in chunks using the ChunkResponder returned.
        Parameters:
        status - the status code to respond with
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.
        Returns:
        chunk responder for sending the response

      • sendContent

        void sendContent(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
               io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf content,
               io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Send response back to client. Default content type is "application/octet-stream", but can be overridden by the headers parameter.
        Parameters:
        status - Status of the response.
        content - Content to be sent back.
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.

      • sendFile

        void sendFile(File file)
              throws IOException,
                     Throwable
        Sends a file content back to client with response status 200 with content type as "application/octet-stream".
        Parameters:
        file - The file to send
        Throws:
        IOException - if failed to open and read the file
        Throwable

      • sendFile

        void sendFile(File file,
            io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
              throws IOException,
                     Throwable
        Sends a file content back to client with response status 200. Default content type is "application/octet-stream", but can be overridden by the headers parameter.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to send
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if failed to open and read the file
        Throwable

      • sendContent

        void sendContent(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
               io.cdap.http.BodyProducer bodyProducer,
               io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Sends response back to client. The response body is produced by the given BodyProducer. This method will return immediate after it is called. Invocation of methods on the given BodyProducer will be triggered from another thread. Default content type is "application/octet-stream", but can be overridden by the headers parameter.
        Parameters:
        status - Status of the response.
        bodyProducer - a BodyProducer to produce response body.
        headers - additional headers to send with the response.
